affected_services: Blocking of social media around exams, Blocking of social media during exams

Ethiopia declared a state of emergency on October 8, 2015 during mass protests. Social media platforms were blocked and coverage of protests was banned. On October 15, Ethiopia issued a directive enumerating prohibited acts during state of emergency and allowing security forces to search or arrest citizens without a warrant.

affected_regions: Oromia region and Addis Ababa city

affected_services: Blocking of whatsapp, Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, some VPN sites, Telegram, YouTube

affected_regions: Kellem Wellega, West Wellega, Horo Gudru Wellega zones

affected_services: Ethiopia partially restored Internet access after a two-week shutdown prompted by protests following the murder of popular singer and political figure Hachalu Hundessa. However, Facebook and Instagram remained blocked.
Facebook, Messenger, some WhatsApp and Telegram servers
